Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
@williamkeffer93  @Hermes routes to coins.json on different platforms:
Windows: C:/Users/<username>/AppData/Roaming/BarterDEX
Linux: /home/<Username>/.BarterDEX
MacOS: ~/Library/Application \Support/BarterDEX

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: For Mac you will need to press in the file explorer Command+Shift+G and you should be able to access that folder

Author: optickle#9937
Content: Hmmm.  Maybe I was using barterdex!  lol.  I have the recovery phrase on that.

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: If that still doesn't help I will recommend a fresh reinstallation ...and yes is coins.json not config.file I mixed it with Agama

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: @optickle If you've used Native mode and able to see the balance in native mode you definetly can backup `wallet.dat` from this PC. If you used Lite mode you have to backup seed phrase instead

Author: optickle#9937
Content: ok

Might be useful if you used Native mode üòÉ But you have to investigate first in which mode you registered wallet (other words in in which mode you can see funds now)

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: @williamkeffer93 I will be out of desk but if erasing the coins.json file doesn't work you can try to erase the Barterdex folder and do a fresh installation...Only do this if you don't have any stuck swap or zeroconf deposit pending , after a fresh install it should work without issues.

Author: williamkeffer93#6847
Content: @Hermes I got it working. Deleting barterdex folder and reinstall did the trick thanks

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content:
I found an additional option, @Nabob .

In the router settings, I was able to "view network," and there I can see the ip addresses of the machines in real time.

I also did a "reserve DHCP address," and now both of my wireless machines are able to ping each other whenever I want! üòÉ

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Running into an issue ,  JavaScript error when trying to run 42c

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: @polycryptoblog Are you running it in Windows?

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Yes

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
https://support.komodoplatform.com/solution/articles/29000024854-agama-javascript-error-windows-version/en
Try to erase `config.json` file inside the Agama folder as shown in this guide.
Go to `%appdata%/Roaming/Agama`, erase this file and restart Agama.

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Ok will do

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Did the trick thanks
